holidays.name: International Sticky Bun Day
holidays.description: A deliciously sweet day dedicated to enjoying the gooey, cinnamon-swirled treat known as the sticky bun.
holidays.origin: While the exact origins are unclear, sticky buns have been a beloved American pastry since the 18th century, and this quirky day celebrates their mouthwatering glory.
holidays.funFact: Sticky buns were once called 'clover leaf rolls' and sometimes baked with pecans or walnuts for an extra crunch!

holidays.name: Single Tasking Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to ditch multitasking and focus on one task at a time to boost productivity and reduce stress.
holidays.origin: Originated as a mindful productivity movement to combat the modern habit of juggling too many things at once.
holidays.funFact: Studies show single-tasking can increase productivity by 20-40%, but very few people practice it daily!

holidays.name: World Sound Healing Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the healing power of sound and music, promoting therapy through vibrations and frequencies.
holidays.origin: Sound healing has roots in ancient cultures like Tibetan chanting and Aboriginal didgeridoos, and this day celebrates its modern therapeutic revival.
holidays.funFact: Certain sound frequencies like 528 Hz are believed to encourage DNA repair and promote well-being!

holidays.name: National Sticky Bun Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the sticky bun, a sweet treat similar to a cinnamon roll but often with nuts and sticky syrup topping.
holidays.origin: Primarily celebrated in the U.S., this day indulges lovers of the gooey pastry on February 21 annually.
holidays.funFact: Sticky buns were so popular during Victorian times that entire cookbooks were dedicated to their luscious variations!
